shortDescription.text: No changelog found. Please add a changelog file. Refer to the galaxy.md file for more info.

help.text: Confirm via galaxy.yml file if collection version is greater than or equal to 1.0.0 and check for changelog.

shortDescription.text: galaxy.yaml must have one of the required tags: ['application', 'cloud', 'database', 'infrastructure', 'linux', 'monitoring', 'networking', 'security', 'storage', 'tools', 'windows']

help.text: Confirm via galaxy.yml file if collection version is greater than or equal to 1.0.0 and check for changelog.

shortDescription.text: $ None is not of type 'object'. See https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/devel/dev_guide/developing_collections_structure.html#meta-directory

help.text:
Returned errors will not include exact line numbers, but they will mention
the schema name being used as a tag, like ``schema[playbook]``,
``schema[tasks]``.

This rule is not skippable and stops further processing of the file.

If incorrect schema was picked, you might want to either:

* move the file to standard location, so its file is detected correctly.
* use ``kinds:`` option in linter config to help it pick correct file type.

message.text: No changelog found. Please add a changelog file. Refer to the galaxy.md file for more info.
galaxy.yaml must have one of the required tags: ['application', 'cloud', 'database', 'infrastructure', 'linux', 'monitoring', 'networking', 'security', 'storage', 'tools', 'windows']

Returned errors will not include exact line numbers, but they will mention
the schema name being used as a tag, like ``schema[playbook]``,
``schema[tasks]``.

This rule is not skippable and stops further processing of the file.

If incorrect schema was picked, you might want to either:

* move the file to standard location, so its file is detected correctly.
* use ``kinds:`` option in linter config to help it pick correct file type.
